meanings.definition: A humorous imitation of something, typically a film or television show.
meanings.sent1: The spoofs of popular movies always make me laugh.
meanings.sent2: I watched a funny spoof of a famous TV series last night.
meanings.sent3: The spoof of the detective show was so silly and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her spoof of the award-winning film was both clever and amusing.
meanings.sent5: The comedy group's spoof of the superhero movie was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A trick played on someone as a joke.
meanings.sent1: The spoofs they pulled on April Fools' Day were hilarious.
meanings.sent2: She fell for his silly spoof and couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent3: Their spoof on the teacher's birthday was a lighthearted prank.
meanings.sent4: The spoof they played on their friend was harmless and fun.
meanings.sent5: The siblings' spoof on each other always ended in laughter.

meanings.sent1: He spoofs famous movie scenes to make people chuckle.
meanings.sent2: She always spoofs her favorite TV characters for fun.
meanings.sent3: Spoofing the president's speech was a hilarious skit.
meanings.sent4: The comedian spoofed the popular song in a comical way.
meanings.sent5: Spoofing the news anchor's voice never fails to entertain.
